title: Breakfast Server
description:
The AM Server is responsible for providing exceptional customer service to guests during breakfast hours. This role involves taking orders, serving food and beverages, and ensuring a pleasant dining experience for all guests. Must be able to start working at 6am.

Responsibilities:

* Welcoming guests as they arrive, escorting them to their tables, and providing menus.
* Writing down or entering food and beverage orders into a system.
* Bringing out the ordered items in a timely manner, ensuring that everything is correct and to the guests' liking.
* Keeping guests’ coffee, tea, juice, and water refilled.
* Clearing dishes, wiping down tables, and resetting them for the next guests.
* Being knowledgeable about the breakfast menu, including ingredients and preparation methods, and able to suggest items.
* Processing bills and payments, often using a point-of-sale (POS) system.
* Ensuring that the dining area is clean and well-organized throughout the breakfast service.

Qualifications:

* Previous experience as an AM server
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
* Attention to detail and ability to multitask.
* Basic math skills for handling payments.
* Positive attitude and professional appearance.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $24.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid sick time

Shift:

* Morning shift

Experience:

* Serving: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Construction Superintendent
description:
At L+M Development Partners, working together to build stronger communities is our mission. Our double bottom line philosophy means that we measure success not only in financial returns but also by the positive impacts we make in the communities we serve.
  
  

Founded in 1984, L+M is a full-service real estate development firm that develops, invests, constructs, and manages properties with industry-leading innovation in a variety of urban markets nationwide, primarily in the New York Tristate Area. Recognized as one of the top affordable housing developers in the country, L+M and its affiliate companies are responsible for approximately $20 billion in development and investment, and combined have over 55,000 high-quality residential units in construction or that have been acquired, preserved, or completed.
  
  

**Please visit our website for more information:** http://lmdevpartners.com. To learn more about our mission and values, go to https://lmdevpartners.com/mission-and-values/.
  
  

**Areas of Responsibility:**  

Assist in carrying out essential field duties at the jobsite within the area of responsibility.
  
  

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**  

* Receives technical and operational direction from the Superintendent.
* Assist Superintendent with planning work, trade sequencing, and coordination of trades (materials takeoffs, equipment, etc.
* Review submittals and confirms job compliance with design and field conditions.
* Assists with or prepares daily construction reports and/or incident reports.
* Must be able to communicate effectively to all project participants.
* Directs subcontractor activities within the area of responsibility.
* Implements and enforces procedures and related work rules as established by the Superintendent and Project Manager.
* Ensures safety standards and requirements are implemented and adhered to and that tools and equipment are in safe condition and operated safely.
* Strong knowledge of safety compliance including federal, state, and local safety codes.
* Recognizes when problems exist and evaluates the facts to resolve issues efficiently. Seeks assistance from supervisor when necessary.
* Maintain positive attitude towards field work and demonstrates sound judgment in making field decisions.
* Determines the priority of assignments based on critical deadlines that must be met.


Perform additional assignments at the direction of the superintendent.
  
  

**Minimum Education Requirements:**  

* Bachelor’s degree preferred in engineering, architecture, or construction management, or equivalent work experience with high school or vocational degree.


**Minimum Years of Experience Required:**  

* 2-5 years


**Additional Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**  

* MS Word and Excel are required.
* AutoCAD is recommended.


L+M offers competitive compensation and benefits and tremendous potential with a growing residential real estate developer/builder organization.
  
L+M is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
  
**Disclaimer:** Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

title: STRATEGIC ACCOUNTS MANAGER
description:
Join the largest manufacturer of tile and natural stone in the United States and watch your career stand out with Dal-Tile, a subsidiary of Mohawk Industries.

  


Our close-knit team of dedicated professionals has made us the success we are today. In exchange for their hard work, we support our people with a family-friendly work environment, a commitment to promoting from within, unique benefits that go beyond just medical and dental, and a belief that every employee deserves a productive life outside of work. If this sounds outstanding to you, take the first step forward and explore a career with Dal-Tile.

  



Dal-Tile is seeking a Strategic Account Manager that is responsible for increasing commercial sales for Dal-Tile by creating new opportunities with end user and developer clients and by driving project specifications in collaboration with the Architectural team, through bid and order placement with the commercial sales representatives and SSC Managers.

  


**STRATEGIC ACCOUNTS MANAGER - #133 Manhattan, NY Design Studio:**


Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $104,800 and $131,000 + Quarterly Incentive\\* per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the compensation package, which depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other company sponsored benefit programs.

  


Primary Objective

  


Increases commercial sales for Dal-Tile by creating new opportunities with end user and developer clients and by driving project specifications in collaboration with the Architectural team, through bid and order placement with the commercial sales representatives and SSC Managers.

  


Major Function and Scope

  


Research, analyzes and develops effective MSA / market segment sales strategies.


Help achieve desired sales increase over prior year in strategically assigned Regional MSA markets.


Develops strong business relationships with specified accounts, Builder / Dealer / Contract Installers.


Works closely with designated business opportunities to:


Develop account relationships to become preferred supplier.


Develop sales growth strategy with account key decision makers.


Develop and manage product sales mix to maximize sales, profit, and eliminate competition.


Train and develop Daltile account sales staff on programs and products to effectively support and penetrate target customers / business segments.


Develop & implement display presentations and enhance merchandising of Dal-Tile products to achieve maximum sales results.


Defines goals and objectives and communicates objectives on a regular basis. Measures Sales performance against objectives established for Regional target MSA’s.


Communicates with Architectural Sales Representatives, Dealer Sales Representatives, Regional Sales Management, Corporate Management, SSC Managers by providing current information regarding Market and account-specific programs.


Communicates and works closely with Regional and Corporate Management to maximize market penetration and margin potential for the Mohawk Group.


Helps to trains Sales/Architectural Representatives on buying group programs, customer incentive programs and promotions where necessary.


Communicates and coordinates activities with Marketing and Product Planning associates.


Performs other assigned duties as required to support Corporate and Regional Objectives.

  


Experience and Knowledge Required

  


Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent working experience.

  


Extensive working knowledge of the Commercial end user and developer market

  


4+ years of related sales account management and industry experience.

  


Resides in territory

  


Proven market knowledge and success with clients while in a similar role

  


Competencies

  


Self-starter, strong communication skills, organizational skills, exercises independent judgment and initiative.

  


Other Pertinent Job Information

  


While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, use hands and reach with hands and arms. The employee is required to walk, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. title: Social Worker, Immigration Practice
description:
TheCenter for Family Representation Inc. (CFR)is an award-winning, innovative law and policy organization that serves primarily Black and Brown families and youth in Queens, Manhattan, and the Bronx with an interdisciplinary legal defense model that serves more than 2400 clients every year. In 2024, CFR will expand our family defense practice to Richmond County. CFR was originally founded in 2002 to dramatically change the trajectory of indigent parents being prosecuted by the Citys Administration for Childrens Services (ACS). Our goal is to defend and protect our clients rights, reduce the harm of family separation and prevent or minimize the time any child spends in the foster system.


CFR provides interdisciplinary family defense with a model that was unique at our founding and that is now being replicated nationally: we assign every client an attorney and a social work staff member, and teams have the support of parent advocates, who are parents with direct personal experience of being investigated and prosecuted by ACS. CFR was the first agency in the country to integrate parents with lived experience into legal teams and now has 7 parent advocates working in all three of our family defense locations. CFRsCommunity Advocacy Projectrepresents parents during a child protective investigation (to avoid court involvement where possible) and assists parents in clearing their names from state maltreatment records.


As an agency committed to securing justice for families, we built theYouth Defense practice (YDP)to defend youth at risk of family separation through incarceration. YDP uses the same interdisciplinary model to represent youth being prosecuted in Queens and Manhattan in Supreme Court Youth Parts, during Probation Adjustment and in Delinquency proceedings in Family Court. CFRs Home for Good program provides legal and social work services to CFR clients inimmigration,civil legal servicesandcriminal defensematters, to afford clients an efficient and well-coordinated one-stop solution to a range of issues that threaten family stability.


Recognized as experts in our fields,we annually train over 500 practitioners in the city, state and around the countryon strategies to promote family preservation and interdisciplinary representation, and we provide community based Know Your Rights presentations to parents, youth and service providers.We advocate at the city, state and national level for policies that reduce the harm of family separation, and promote parent engagement and justice for youth and families.


CFR's Immigration Team has an immediate opening for a **Social Worker**.

**Primary responsibilities will include:**

* Work with CFRs immigration team to conduct trauma-informed intakes and meetings, assess needs and goals, provide high quality legal defense against family separation and removal and obtain immigration relief and/or benefits for non-citizen clients.
* In collaboration with our CFR Policy unit, other stakeholders and agencies, advocate against harmful anti-immigrant local/state/federal policies or practices;
* Provide direct social work support and advocacy to clients, refer clients to supportive services that are culturally and linguistically appropriate, facilitate clients attendance at ICE check-ins and other appointments and work closely with services providers (i.e. therapist, case managers, case planners, etc.) to create networks of support and gather evidence in support of clients cases;
* Conduct biopsychosocial evaluations and draft letters of support for clients to achieve positive outcomes with the immigration courts, USCIS, the Administration for Childrens Services and other agencies;
* Participate in team meetings as well as administrative meetings within CFR and
* Keep updated client legal notes and timely enter data in CFRs database.


Social Workers receive supervision from Social Work Supervisors and are expected to keep case data and client legal notes up to date. Social Workers at CFR can expect intensive, interdisciplinary training on CFR's Cornerstone Advocacy model, the immigration system, trauma-informed client interviewing, drafting client letters of support and other critical experiences and skills. Professional development opportunities for Social Workers may include building skills to eventually supervise MSW interns, conduct trainings and participate in CFR's policy initiatives. Objectives of the team include supporting non-citizen families by preventing removal, obtaining immigration relief, accessing benefits and seeking client opportunities.

**Starting salaries**(0 years of experience):


Social Worker (unlicensed): $65,100


Social Worker (licensed): $71,400

* Applicants must have an LMSW or have an MSW degree and be eligible and willing to become licensed within ten months of hire.
* Prior experience advocating for or supporting non-citizens is preferred.
* Fluency in Spanish is required.
* Fluency in French, or Haitian Creole is preferred.
* Experience with immigration, public benefits, education, housing or the family policing system is all desirable.
* Individuals who apply should be able to demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills, a commitment to interdisciplinary representation of non-citizen parents and families in immigration proceedings and a desire to share in both the exhilaration and challenges of a growing endeavor.
company_description: Every Family Matters

title: Store Manager
description:
**MINISO USA - Retail Store Manager (Full-Time)** 

MINISO is an established international brand, and we position ourselves as a variety store, popular among consumers with our high-quality products at low prices. Established from a Japanese designer and Chinese entrepreneur, MINISO has been expanding globally since 2011. In April of 2017, we started our journey within the USA. MINISO is growing as the world’s #1 IP design retail group and wants you to help grow the company even further!

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:** 

* Meet sales goals by training, motivating, mentoring, and providing feedback to sales staff.
* Oversee entire retail store and overall performance to develop the store employees.
* Develop business strategies to increase consumer market, expand store traffic, and optimize profitability.
* Ensure elevated levels of customer satisfaction through excellent customer service.
* Complete store administration and ensure compliance with policies and procedures.
* Maintain outstanding store condition and visual merchandising standards.
* Initiate and implement replenishment strategies within the store.
* Report on buying trends, customer needs, profits, etc.
* Propose innovative ideas to increase market share.
* Conduct personnel performance appraisals to assess training needs and build career paths.
* Deal with all issues that arise from staff or customers (complaints, grievances, etc.).
* Be a shining example of good behavior and high performance.
* Travel to work at other MINISO locations, when needed.
* Additional store manager duties as needed.

**Qualifications:** 

* Educational/ Experience: Associate degree or higher in Business Administration, Organizational Behavior, Hospitality, or related degrees is preferred.
* Communication Skills: Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively communicate with customers, peers, and management. Ability to communicate on the telephone with proper etiquette.
* Mathematical Skills: Possess strong mathematical skills to be able to count money accurately and precisely.
* Reasoning Ability: Ability to multi-task, while being attentive to customers and remaining flexible to the needs of the business. Ability to work as part of a team and take initiative independent of direct supervision.
* Other Sills: Enthusiastic, friendly, and energetic with a genuine desire to provide outstanding service. Powerful leadership skills, organizational skills, customer management, and business orientation.
* Work Hours: Open availability with a minimum availability to work 40 hours per week, which may include early mornings, evenings, weekends, and holidays.
* Ability to travel and/or relocate to various locations and manage additional stores based on company’s needs.

**Physical Requirements:** 

* Ability to stand, bend, stoop, reach, push, pull, and lift up to 40 lbs. in items occasionally (up to 10 times per hour).
* Ability to work extended periods of time (up to 6 hours) standing or walking.
* Ability to perform repetitive motions for short periods of time (up to 3 hours continuously).
* Ability to place and arrange items on shelves and racks daily.
* Ability to read instructions, reports, and information on computer/register screens and to key information into the computer daily.
* Ability to work in retail stores; move about retail stores floors and rooms; review, revise, create retail paperwork.

MINISO is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

We believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented individuals from a diverse candidate pool.

**#LoveMiniso**

title: Mobile Phlebotomist
description:
**Position Overview:**  
As a Mobile Phlebotomist, you will be responsible for traveling to various locations such as patients' homes, doctors' offices, nursing homes, and laboratories to collect blood samples. Your role involves ensuring the safe and efficient collection, transportation, and delivery of blood samples for testing. A minimum of 2 years of experience in phlebotomy is required for this position.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 2 years of experience in phlebotomy, with a demonstrated ability to perform blood draws independently.
* Proficiency in using a centrifuge for sample processing and familiarity with relevant safety procedures.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to interact professionally with patients and healthcare professionals.
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills to maintain accurate records and manage sample transportation effectively.
* Valid driver's license and clean driving record, with the ability to travel to various locations as required.
* Certification or licensure as a phlebotomist.

**Additional Information:**

* This position requires the flexibility to work variable hours, including mornings and weekdays, to accommodate patient schedules and sample collection needs.
* The successful candidate must demonstrate reliability, punctuality, and a commitment to providing high-quality phlebotomy services in diverse settings.

If you meet the qualifications and are excited about the prospect of providing essential phlebotomy services in a mobile capacity, we encourage you to apply for this position.

Responsibilities  
- Perform venipuncture and capillary puncture to collect blood samples from patients  
- Ensure proper specimen collection, labeling, and processing  
- Provide excellent patient care and service during the phlebotomy process  
- Utilize medical terminology and physiology knowledge to accurately perform duties  
- Maintain a high level of accuracy and attention to detail in all tasks  
- Demonstrate strong communication skills when interacting with patients and healthcare staff  
- Utilize organizational skills to prioritize tasks and manage a busy schedule effectively  
- Adhere to all safety protocols and procedures to ensure a safe working environment  
- Drive to various locations to perform phlebotomy services, requiring a valid driver's license  
- Collaborate with the laboratory team to ensure efficient processing of specimens  
- Utilize clinical laboratory experience to enhance the quality of services provided

Job Type: Contract

Pay: Up to $200.00 per day

Work Location: On the road

title: Information Technology Support Specialist, Healthcare
description:
**Who We Are:**

Paul Phillips Eye & Surgery Center is a physician-owned, multi-specialty ophthalmic practice that offers comprehensive eyecare services in surgical and medical retina, cataract and refractive surgery, uveitis, glaucoma, pediatrics, oculoplastics, contact lens fitting and supply, and full service optical. The main location is Flemington, NJ with two satellite offices in Bridgewater and Clinton, NJ.

**Overview**:

The organization has newly created a position of information Technology Support Specialist and is seeking an energetic and self-directed individual who is excited to take on a multi-faceted role that changes every day. As a department of one, the individual will be responsible for overseeing all software, hardware, Electronic Health Records (EHR) system, medical equipment interfaces, and office equipment (scanners, fax, printers, telephones) within the organization. This requires coordinating with our IT consultants, EHR support team, website host, and other support services that are already in place. Prior experience with EHR/EMR systems is strongly desired. NextGen experience is a plus.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* NextGen superuser and point of contact for all NextGen EHR and practice management issues and projects.
* Manages all the equipment in the organization to include PCs, copiers, fax machines, printers, scanners, telephones, postage machine, and medical equipment.
* Acts as the liaison between the organization and our external IT partners for the management and execution of IT-related projects.
* Office 365 administrator responsible for managing users and groups within the organization. This may include creating and managing user accounts; assigning licenses to users; and setting up security groups to control access to resources.
* Acts as the liaison between the organization and the hospital’s IT department.
* Manages the technology workflow to identify problems and implement solutions.
* Troubleshoot and problem solve hardware and software issues.
* Point of contact with the organization’s website host company to coordinate changes and updates. Responsible for making minor modifications and updates.
* Must be able and willing to travel to all three offices in NJ – Flemington, Bridgewater, and Clinton.
* Additional duties as assigned.

**Job Requirements:**

* Hardware proficiency to set up, configure and maintain equipment
* Software knowledge to recommend, install, and configure
* Basic networking skills
* Understands security fundamentals
* Understands database management and cloud services
* Troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
* Organized and detail oriented
* Collaboration skills
* Represents the organization in a professional manner when interacting with external partners

**Education and Experience:**

* High School Diploma or equivalent required; college degree in Computer Science or similar desirable
* Must have 3+ years of IT experience
* Experience working with EHR/EMR systems is highly desirable; NextGen experience a plus
* Must have at least 1 year of Office 365 experience.

title: Maintenance Tech I
description:
**Program:** Genesis Homes Supportive Housing | 330 Hinsdale Street, Brooklyn, NY 11207
  
What You’ll Do
  
At HELP USA, we take great pride in providing our residents with a clean and well-maintained living space. We can only do this with a great maintenance team. As a Maintenance Tech 1 with HELP, you’ll be part of the team that keeps one of our affordable housing communities clean and safe at all times. You’ll clean and maintain the interior and exterior of the property and complete assigned work orders and repairs.
  
  

**Your responsibilities will include:**  

* Cleaning and maintaining leasing office, hallways, public and common areas, back of the house areas, sidewalks, public walkways, stairways, and garden areas in a neat, clean, and attractive condition.
* Compacting and removing trash and debris from trash rooms, trash areas, compactors, community areas, etc.
* Assisting in process of making vacant apartments rent-ready and performing turnkey work as required.
* Maintaining high customer service standards and responding quickly to resident requests to minimize and resolve problems and complaints.


**You’re a great fit for this role if you have:**  

* Valid US Driver’s license.
* Ability to use general maintenance tools, supplies, and equipment such as hand tools, power tools, pressure washers, blowers, painting equipment, chemicals, snow and ice removal equipment, refrigerant tools and recovery equipment, landscaping equipment, etc.
* Ability to lift and move 60 pounds, work in confined spaces, and work at heights over 8 feet.


**It would be helpful (but not required) if you have:**  

* At least a year of experience in maintenance/building trades, such as electrical, plumbing, HVAC, boilers, carpentry, sheetrock, tile, etc.
* High School Diploma or equivalent OR equivalent experience and skills.


We Have GREAT BENEFITS!
  
* Health insurance (including Medical, Dental, and Vision) and Life Insurance provided by Union
* Generous Paid Time Off!
* 2 weeks annual vacation accrues from Day 1
* 3 weeks annual vacation starting at beginning of 2nd full year
* 12 paid holidays, 3 paid personal days, 7 paid sick days (unused sick days carry forward) 401k with Company contribution even if employee doesn't contribute.
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Educational Achievement Award for employees completing educational & certification milestones.
* Flexible Spending Account for health care and dependent care expenses
* Short-term and long-term disability
* Employee Referral Bonus


Who We Are
  
  

At HELP USA, we work to ensure that everyone has a place to call home. We’re one of the nation’s largest non profit homeless services providers and low-income housing developers serving at-risk populations including families, individuals, veterans, survivors of domestic violence, people with physical and mental health challenges and disabilities, and seniors. With an annual operating budget approaching $150 million and 1400 employees working in nearly 60 programs, we have helped over 500,000 people facing homelessness and poverty to build better lives. We hope that you will consider joining our team in the fight against homelessness.
  
  

EOE. A Drug-Free Workplace.
company_description: At HELP USA, we work to ensure that everyone has a place to call home: families, single adults, survivors of domestic violence, veterans and more.

title: TLC Driver
description:
**NYC TLC Licensed Driver Job Description**

**About DH2 Chauffeured Transportation:** DH2 Chauffeured Transportation offers our passengers the highest standards of professionalism, exemplified by our "client first" focus and unwavering attention to detail. As early adopters of impactful technology, we continually enhance the value we provide to customers by reducing risks and expenses associated with travel. Our goal is to consistently delight our clients with every aspect of our service, worldwide.

As an MWBE Certified company, DH2 prioritizes Diversity and Inclusion among our partners and employees. Our company philosophy, "Good is not enough. Excellence in everything we do," reflects our unwavering commitment to our employees, partners, and community, driving our success for over 29 years!

**We Offer:**

* **Paid Training:** Comprehensive training to ensure your success.
* **Company-Owned Vehicles:** DH2 covers gas, tolls, and vehicle cleaning.
* **Career Advancement:** Opportunities for growth within the company.
* **Flexible Shifts:** Part-time or full-time shifts are available.
* **Competitive Compensation:** Starting salary of $20.00/hr up to $22.00/hr, plus benefits, with weekly direct deposit pay.
* **Benefits:** 401k and medical insurance.

**Talent Requirements:**

* **Experience:** 3 or more years in ground transportation.
* **Licensing:** Chauffeur E license and an NYC TLC License.
* **Local Knowledge:** Familiarity with the Tri-State area, including JFK, LGA, EWR, and all five boroughs.
* **Core Values:** Committed, dependable, team player, professional, determined, integrity, and authentic.
* **Attributes:** Flexible, reliable, and a team player.
* **Communication:** Good communication skills.
* **Customer Service:** Strong customer service skills.
* **Compliance:** Must submit to DOT CDL Pre-Employment Drug Test and Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration Background Check.
* **Navigation:** Ability to navigate GPS/read maps; knowledge of the five boroughs is a plus.
* **Availability:** Must be able to work varied schedules, including evening/overnight, weekend, and holiday shifts.

**Join DH2 Chauffeured Transportation** and be part of a company that values **excellence, diversity, and inclusion** in every aspect of our operations. If you are a committed, dependable team player with a professional demeanor, determination, integrity, and authenticity, we invite you to apply for the NYC TLC Licensed Driver position. Apply today to embark on a rewarding career with endless growth opportunities!

title: Van Driver
description:
Are you ready to embark on a rewarding driving career without the need for a CDL? At Hallcon, we've got you covered – from providing the vehicle, fuel, insurance, to comprehensive training. You just sit, click your seatbelt, and drive safely!
  
  

Our primary mission is to provide safe, dependable transportation to members of railroad crews, contributing to the crucial operations of the railways.
  
  

**Job Highlights:**  

* Full-Time and Part-Time Opportunities
* No high school, GED, or resume required
* No CDL necessary
* No high-pressure delivery quotas, loading/unloading packages, or prolonged standing
* Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits, 401k
* Holiday Pay
* Paid Training


**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Safely and reliably transport railroad crews to assigned locations
* Conduct thorough pre-trip and post-trip inspections of the assigned vehicle
* Utilize navigation tools effectively
* Adhere to Hallcon's safe driving standards
* Ability to communicate and write in English
* Flexible hours and varying schedules (not scheduled)


**Minimum Requirements:**  

* Minimum age of 21
* Current valid state-issued driver's license
* Preferably live within a 30-minute distance of the location
* Successful completion of pre-employment drug screen and background check


**Pay Rate:** Starting at $15.43.
  
  

Apply now and be an essential part of North America’s transportation network.
  
  

Hallcon is a mobility and infrastructure services company focused on turnkey solutions for clients such as technology companies, manufacturers, railroads, universities, corporate business parks, hospitals, airports, public transportation agencies and more.
  
  

Hallcon is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

title: Roofing Foreman
description:
We are seeking a Roofing Foreman to oversee residential roofing projects. The candidate must be detailed oriented, have 5+ years prior experience in the residential roofing trade, thoroughly ensure the timely completion of projects while adhering to policies.

**Responsibilities will include:**

· Coordinate crews daily

· Ensure daily/weekly reports and paperwork submitted on time

* Setting project sites up including equipment and scaffolding.
* Identifying safety related issues and correcting those issues including making sure that all members of the crew are meeting OSHA safety standards.
* Understanding the overall roof assembly being installed and overseeing the installation of the materials into a complete and functional roofing system.
* Understanding how materials and roofing systems go together and come apart in order to complete repairs to existing roofing systems.
* Communicating with members of the crew as well as project supervisor and/or business owner.
* Maintaining project sites in a neat and orderly fashion.

**General Requirements:**

* 5+ years of experience in residential roofing, with demonstrated expertise in installing and repairing various types of roofing systems and siding preferably.
* 2 years foreman experience
* Some Spanish would be a plus but not necessary.
* Strong knowledge of roofing materials, techniques, and best practices, with a keen eye for detail and quality.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact professionally with contractors, and team members.
* Ability to read and interpret blueprints, specifications, and technical drawings.
* Familiarity with roofing management software – Eagle View/Bluebeam A+/Excel

· Have a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record

description:

title: Environmental Compliance Specialist
description:
Belshire is a 100% employee owned, established environmental services company. Our diverse client base ranges from small local businesses to large Fortune 100 companies. Our dedicated team includes seasoned regulatory experts who utilize tailored compliance and document management programs to ensure regulatory tasks are completed accurately and on time for our customers.

We are in search of a talented, dependable, and hardworking individual to join our team as an Environmental Compliance Specialist.

Environmental Compliance Specialists work at both underground storage tank (UST) and aboveground storage tank (AST) facilities. Alongside inspections, a crucial part of this role involves providing training to facility employees. These employees serve as the first line of defense against spills that could potentially reach storm drains, ensuring the cleanliness of our waterways.

**AS AN ENVIRONMENTAL COMPLIANCE SPECIALIST, YOU WILL:**

* Conduct regulatory visual inspections at gas stations and other UST and AST facilities.
* Effectively communicate crucial information to assist our clients in maintaining compliance with federal, state, district, and local regulations.
* Provide training to designated facility employees on required safety and compliance duties.
* Complete inspection report forms.
* Perform additional environmental regulatory audits as required by client and location.
* Act independently and as part of a team to make appropriate compliance recommendations.
* Perform regular safety checks on all field equipment and complete vehicle inspection reports.

**YOU CAN SUCCEED AT THIS JOB IF:**

* You enjoy working outdoors in the field. This position involves approximately 4 days per week of fieldwork at our customer sites. Typically, one day per week is dedicated to office tasks completed remotely from your home office. (80% field/20% home office)
* You have the ability to pass the Class A and B UST Operator Training Certification after completing our company-sponsored training program.
* You work well independently.
* You have the ability to collaborate with a team.
* You have a strong attention to detail with a focus on quality.
* You have excellent time management skills.
* You have excellent written & verbal communication skills.
* You enjoy problem solving.
* You are proficient with computers and learning new software.

**FACTORS FOR SUCCESS:**

* Successful completion of the Class A and B UST Operator Training certification is required after completing the company-sponsored training program (required).
* Personal vehicle to be used for travel between job sites (required).
* Valid NY driver’s license with excellent driving record (required).
* Ability to pass background screening after a conditional job offer is made and accepted (required).
* Suitable candidates will be located in or near the job location (required).
* Bachelor's Degree (preferred).
* Customer Service experience (preferred).
* Field experience, working outdoors (preferred).
* Overnight travel may be required (expenses reimbursed).

**PAY:**

* Starting hourly rate will be $20.00 - $22.00 per hour.
* $500 bonus to be paid after your 90-day anniversary.
* Travel time between your home office and job sites is paid at your regular hourly rate.
* Mileage between your home office and job sites is reimbursed at IRS standard mileage rates.
* All training and fees associated with obtaining required certification will be paid.

**HOW WE HELP YOU SUCCEED:**

We provide great training, generous compensation, and comprehensive benefits that allow our employees to find fulfillment and security in personal life and career alike. These include:

* Competitive pay and benefits as noted above.
* We provide all the equipment required to perform your work in the field and from your home office.
* Work-Life Balance. This is a Monday through Friday position (no weekends) with moderate to minimal overtime.
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance as part our commitment to investing in the health and well-being of our employees.
* 401k savings plan.
* Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP).
* Paid sick, vacation, and holiday pay.
* Helpful co-workers and management.
* Advancement and growth opportunities.
* Networking with others in the environmental industry.

Job Type: Full-time

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, natural origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected status. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.

title: Wendys Wonderful Kid Recruiter
description:
The Wendys Wonderful Kids program, aims to increase adoptions from foster care, focusing primarily on children for whom it has been traditionally difficult to find families: older children, groups of siblings, and children with physical or emotional challenges. The philosophy of Wendys Wonderful Kids (WWK) is that Unadoptable is Unacceptable. WWK adoption recruiters employ effective, aggressive, and accountable child-focused recruitment activities. They directly engage youth to explore their attitudes towards adoption and seek their input on prospective adoptive resources. Recruiters conduct an exhaustive search for people with whom the child has had a bond or positive relationship

**Responsibilities:*** Maintains a case load of 12 to 15 foster children in need of loving, permanent homes.
* Responsible for being highly responsive to communications with case planners, youth, and families.
* Maintains accurate files and ensures all quarterly documentation is completed in a timely and accurate manner.
* Ensures all contact notes are complete and up to date, accurate and done on a timely schedule.
* Enters required monthly documentation into Child Trends database in an accurate and timely manner.
* Completes monthly visitation with all active clients.
* Maintains regular contact with case planners assigned to cases.
* Attends family team meeting and/or treatment team meetings on a regular basis.
* Works with child welfare and other professionals involved with the childs case for informational and planning purposes and to support recruitment efforts.
* Engages in Child Focused Recruitment for each child using the WWK model as a guide.
* Conducts diligent search for biological family members and other previous connections who may be resources for the waiting child.
* Conducts file reviews of case records regularly to build a strong understanding of the clients history and needs.
* Meets annual match and adoption goals set by the Dave Thomas Foundation and ACS.
* Supports children and families once matched to help ensure stability of placement and finalization.
* Serves as a liaison for prospective adoptive families and the childs county.

**Other Duties:*** Attends and actively participates a variety of internal and/or external meetings, committees, and/or events which may not be job related, but are related to the agencys clients, mission, and/or its employees, such as but not limited to, All Staff Meetings, employee annual and or ad-hoc benefits meetings, agency galas, etc.
* Complete training requirements established for WWK recruiters by the Dave Thomas Foundation for Adoption and trainings required by C.A.S.E.
* Performs other related duties as may be required.

* Candidates must have bachelors degree, preferablyin Social Work or Human Services field
* Understanding and working knowledge of the field of human service with a special emphasis on foster care children.
* Possessesunderstanding child welfare client population.
* Demonstrated knowledge and ability to manage an active caseload of 12 to 15 of foster children who are difficult to place in permanent homes.
* Demonstrated knowledge and the ability to implement proactive, child-focused recruitment programs targeted exclusively on moving long waiting kids from foster care to into adoptive families.
* Good interpersonal skills including the ability to work with a wide audience of internal and external parties.
* Good verbal and written communication skills including proper grammar and spelling. Ability to write reports, business correspondence and give oral presentations, as may be needed.
* Good organizational skills including attention to detail, accuracy, and follow-through; including working knowledge and hands-on practice of efficient filing systems,
* Good basic arithmetic skills including attention to detail and follow-through.
* Skilled in the use of Windows based PC environment and Microsoft Office tools such as Outlook, WORD, EXCEL; PowerPoint preferred.
* Ability to quickly learn and efficiently, effectively, and accurately utilize job and/or industry specific software tools and applications necessary for the job.

**Benefits:**

* Rewarding Work in a team environment;
* Paid vacation, sick, personal days and holidays;
* 403(B) retirement plan;
* Health, dental, vision and life insurance;
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
* Flexible spending account (Dependent Care, Medical, Parking, and Transit);
* Employee Appreciation Programs and Events;
* Tuition Assistance Program;
* Professional Development opportunities;

title: Dental Assistant
description:
What you’ll do…
  
Join our dynamic and thriving dental practice as a Dental Assistant! At Great Expressions Dental Centers, we're seeking an energetic and motivated individual to join our team and positively impact our patients' oral health. If you're looking for a fast-paced environment where every day brings new challenges and opportunities, this is the perfect position for you!
  
Pay information…
  
* Competitive pay starting at $18/hr. – PLUS ANNUAL BONUS!


What you’ll bring to the team…
  
* Assist our experienced dental team in providing exceptional patient care
* Prepare treatment rooms, sterilize instruments, and ensure a clean and organized environment
* Educate patients on proper oral hygiene techniques and post-treatment care
* Support dentists during procedures, anticipating their needs and ensuring smooth workflow
* Perform basic dental procedures under the guidance of a licensed dentist
* Manage appointment scheduling and maintain patient records accurately


Requirements…
  
Before applying, it is imperative that you meet the state requirements outlined below:
  
* Connecticut: certification and proof of formal training to expose X-rays.
* Florida: Expanded Functions Dental Assistant (EFDA) certification and proof of formal training to expose X-rays (including FDOH Permit to expose X-rays).
* Georgia: CPR Certification, Expanded Functions Dental Assistant (EFDA) certification, and proof of formal training to expose X-rays.
* Massachusetts: CPR Certification, proof of formal training to expose X-rays, BORID certification and annual CE requirements must be completed per state regulations.
* Michigan: Upon hiring, you are required to furnish evidence of X-ray training certification. If you do not possess certification at the time of hiring, you are granted an 8-week period to submit it.
* New Jersey: Proof of X-ray training.
* New York: Not applicable.
* Ohio: Proof of formal training to expose X-rays (including FDOH Permit to Expose X-rays)
* Texas: CPR Certification, TSBDE: TX State Board of Dental Examiners.


It would be even better if you also had…
  
* 2+ years of previous dental assisting experience or relevant education is preferred
* Excellent organizational skills with a keen eye for detail
* Strong communication skills and a friendly, compassionate demeanor
* Ability to multitask and thrive in a fast-paced environment
* Proficiency in dental software and technology is a plus


Perks of the job…
  
* Medical and Prescription Coverage administered by Blue Cross Blue Shield
* Access to the Nation’s Best Employee Dental Program
* Vision Plan
* 401(k) (Traditional and Roth) administered by Fidelity
* Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts
* Basic Life (up to $50k at no cost) and AD&D Insurance
* Optional Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability and Term Life Insurance
* Power of One Rewards and Recognition
* Employee Assistance Program
* Vacation and Holiday Pay
* Referral Bonuses


About GEDC…
  
Since 1982, Great Expressions has been at the forefront of dental innovation, setting the standard for exceptional care and unforgettable patient experiences. Now, we're entering a new era of transformation, and we want you to be a part of it. Our recently appointed leadership team brings over a century of collective dental expertise and is backed by dynamic investment support to pave the way for groundbreaking changes. We're channeling our resources and energy into revolutionizing our technology platform, expanding service offerings, and creating a personalized patient experience that goes beyond the expected. At Great Expressions, we're not just transforming dentistry; we're investing in the growth and development of our team. Join us and be a part of a career that blends innovation and professionalism, where your contribution shapes the future of dental excellence.
  
  

GEDC is committed to diversity and inclusion and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are welcomed and encouraged to apply.

Our multidisciplinary health care team includes physicians, nurse practitioners, industrial hygienists, ergonomists, social workers, workers’ compensation and benefits specialists who provide comprehensive patient-centered services.

title: Behavior Technician (RBT) ABA Therapy
description:
**Position: Behavior Technician / ABA Therapist (Part-Time)**

Looking for a full-time ABA therapist to provide services at our center Monday-Friday (up to 40 hours per week).

**About our organization:** Autism Learning Institute (ALI) is a trusted ABA therapy company providing center-based, in-home, community and school-based services to children diagnosed with ASD and other comorbidities. ALI is comprised of Behavior Analysts (BCBAs), Behavior Technicians (RBTs/BTs) and a strong administrative team who work together to provide ABA services for children with autism throughout northern New Jersey. We were founded with the belief that every child and their family should have access to high quality and effective individualized treatment applying the evidence-based science of ABA. Our belief is that every child can learn. For more information visit our website (www.ali-therapy.com).

**What’s exciting about joining the Autism Learning Institute team and how we can benefit you!**

* Free Supervision for BCBA candidates
* Weekly in-person BCBA oversight provided
* Free RBT training provided and a training library to elevate your skills
* Additional professional development, and more!
* Flexible schedules
* Opportunity for growth / career advancement
* Health, Dental and Vision Benefits!

**Responsibilities/Job Description:**

* Provide behavior intervention services to children diagnosed with Autism and related disorders in the center, home, school, and in the community
* Implement behavior intervention and skill acquisition plans created by and under the supervision of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
* Collect and record data
* Complete accurate treatment notes in a timely manner
* Strictly follow and enforce BACB guidelines
* Attend team meetings
* Motivate and encourage clients and staff

**Critical Functions (may include but are not necessarily limited to):**

* Be able to lift 25‐50 pounds
* Be able to run short distances, sit on the floor, bend down, squat and kneel, quick reflexes to block or prevent behaviors from occurring
* Must have access to own computer, tablet or smart phone in order to graph data and write session notes utilizing the CentralReach practice management platform
* Must have access to vehicle for transportation to clients’ homes or other locations throughout the service area (e.g., daycare, school or community outings)

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree or actively pursuing undergraduate degree in related field (i.e., psychology, early childhood education preferred but not required)
* RBT certificate or completion of RBT certificate within 60 days of hire date
* Completion of background check
* Completion of two professional reference checks
* Prior training in first aid or completion of Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) training within 30 days of hire date
* Demonstrate ability to learn and implement behavior intervention program(s) and behavior plans based on the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)
* Demonstrate ability to communicate with multiple parents/family members.

Work Remotely

description:
**Position Title:** Per Diem BCBA

**Setting & Location**: Variable

**Position Type:** Per Diem

**Pay:** Commensurate with skill level and experience.

**Job Responsibilities w/ case info:**

**Age/Gender: 4 year old male.**

**Location, Brooklyn, NY in person, 11238**

**Family Schedule:**  In Person, Monday-Friday, 2:30p-5:30p

· Obtain and maintain 1+ case(s) & meet all approved hours of the authorization,

· Reach out to the family of every new case received within 3 business days.

· Interviewstaff and/or family members who know the patient before the development of the treatment plan to get the necessary background and preliminary information.

· Conduct initial assessments and periodic 3- or 6-month re-assessments promptly, submittingthem by the due date assigned. Ensure the completed treatment plan addresses the function of the problem behaviors.

· Define all target behaviors in objective and measurable terms and add them to the treatment plan to measure the target behaviors.

· Integrate the proper setting event, antecedent, teaching, and consequence strategies to reduce the patient’s problem behavior and increase alternative replacement behaviors.

· Directly see the patient in all relevant settings. Analyze the data to determinethe function of the problem behavior. Describe where, when, and why the problem behaviors occur while supplying descriptive monthly progress notes.

· Train staff and family members directly, allowing enough time for questions and discussion about the implementation of the treatment plan.

· Assume responsibility for parent training, ABA (Applied Behavioral Analysis) therapist supervision, and treatment planning/BTM services for each case.

· Record all session notes in the Provider Portal and finalize monthly notes on or before given deadlines.

· Review your patients’ behavior data and note any discrepancies (e.g., lack of documentation, inappropriate restrictions, or lack of proper consequences) and situations in which the current behavior program or treatment approach were not followed appropriately. Check each report to ensure that the time, date, signatures, are correct).

· If the intervention has not produced substantial progress toward the intended goal within 90 days (about 3 months), analyze the potential barriers to implementation and/or change the treatment plan if necessary.

· Perform administrative tasks as needed within one business day. (Form completion, signing insurance documents, etc.)

**Minimum Training and Experience:**

Individuals who provide ABA services through behavior analytic services shall be licensed behavior analysts with a scope of practice that includes overseeing the provision of ABA services and have a BCBAcertification (Board Certified Behavioral Analyst) through the BACB (Behavior Analyst Certification Board).

Individuals will also have at least 6 months of experience in rendering ABA services and a master's degree in psychology, social work, counseling, education, or related field.

title: Division Head of Housing
description:
The County of Hunterdon is seeking a Division Head of Housing to oversee the successful administration of the federally funded, Section 8 Voucher Program. The Division Head of Housing will report directly to the Human Services Administrator. The Division Head will formulate management policies and practices in conjunction with the Human Services Administrator and will be responsible for directing the successful implementation of all management policies and practices. The Division Head of Housing will be tasked with overseeing all elements of the Section 8 Voucher Program which includes but is not limited to the oversight of staff, screening of clients, ensuring the ongoing inspection of housing facilities, payments to landlords and ongoing maintenance of the housing waiting list. Salary commensurate with experience.

**Requirements**: A bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 2 years of management experience in the field of social services is preferred.

**To Apply:** Please submit a **County Employment Application including a Resume & Cover Letter**: http://www.co.hunterdon.nj.us/pdf/jobapp.pdf

**Send to:** Hunterdon County Human Resources, 71 Main Street, PO Box 2900, Flemington NJ 08822

*An employee must be able to perform the essential functions of the position satisfactorily and, if requested, reasonable accommodations will be made to enable employees with disabilities to perform the essential functions of their job, absent undue hardship.*

*The Hunterdon County Board of County Commissioners is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity and anti-discrimination pursuant to Title VII of the 1964 Civil Rights Act as amended by the Equal Opportunity Act of 1972 and the New Jersey Law Against Discrimination (LAD) and all other applicable state or federal laws. Under no circumstances will the County discriminate on the basis of sex, race, creed, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, domestic partnership status, civil union status, atypical heredity, cellular or blood trait, genetic information, disability (including AIDS or HIV infection), pregnancy, breastfeeding, childbirth, liability for service in the United States Armed Forces, gender identity or expression, and/or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law.* 

*The County will ensure that personnel decisions are made in accordance with principles of Equal Employment Opportunity by imposing only nondiscriminatory job requirements. The County will not discriminate with regard to any term, condition or privilege of employment, including compensation. Employer-sponsored training, education, tuition assistance, and social and recreation programs will be administered without discrimination. The County has an Affirmative Action Officer ("AAO"), who is assigned overall responsibility of the Affirmative Action Program. Any employee or applicant with a question or grievance should contact the Affirmative Action Officer: Meagan Q. O'Reilly, Director of Human Resources at 908-788-1114.*

***\\*This position is covered by the New Jersey Civil Service Commission and is an unclassified appointment and does not require an examination, and all service is considered “at will” employment. Initial appointments are evaluated using a 90-day working test period.***

description:

The Office Services Specialist will provide constant assistance to staff in the day-to-day operation of the organization. Responsible for daily tasks such as answering main phone line, receiving all visitors, sorting and distributing mail, managing office supply inventory, coordinating office catering, maintaining office kitchen supplies, and overall general support of all administrative services.

**Essential Functions:** 

* Manage all aspects of the Front Office to include answering the phone, receiving and directing all visitors, guests, and service/delivery people
* Sort and distribute incoming and outgoing mail
* Monitor and order office supplies as needed
* Coordinate/schedule training for corporate training, OSHA and safety
* Coordinate travel arrangements
* Safety- manage accident investigations, emergency evacuation, attend meetings
* Company events planning
* Manage company store and ordering of merchandise
* Ensure kitchen and employee lounges/break rooms are stocked appropriately
* Perform copying and binding services as necessary and maintain copies as needed
* Special projects or assistance which may include working on mass mailings, data input, corporate scheduling and general support of Company sponsored events
* Other special projects and additional duties as assigned

**Education/Experience:**

* High School Degree and a minimum of 2 years of job-related experience
* Proficient in MS Excel, Word, and Outlook
* High level of interpersonal skills
* Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality
* Professional with excellent communication, writing and presentation skills
* High attention to detail and proof reading capabilities
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and prioritize workload

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $49,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Junior Underwriter
description:
**Seeking the right candidate for immediate hire to join our growing underwriting team today. Must have minimum one year experience in MCA!**

Overnight Capital, LLC is seeking a driven and dynamic individual to join our growing team as an Underwriter. The ideal candidate must have experience in the Merchant Cash Advance industry who works with integrity and excellence, and who values teamwork, customer service, diversity, and accountability. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone looking to join a growing team in a fast-paced work environment.

**About the Role:**

As part of the Underwriting team, you will assist underwriters in analyzing application data including financial statements, bank statements, credit card statements & due diligence tasks. You will assist underwriters in providing technical and analytical guidance in gathering and analyzing financial information and interface with Senior Management to discuss underwriting and risk decisions and strategies.

**Our ideal candidate will be someone who:**

* Has commitment to integrity, excellence, accountability, customer service, and teamwork.
* Has a strong work ethic, and an eagerness to learn.
* Who has good interpersonal skills, attention to detail and a genuine commitment to the success of the team.
* Feels empowered to help solve escalated issues and work towards making a wrong a right.
* Has the ability to work in a high paced environment.
* Is technically minded.
* Is flexible and adaptable to change.
* Has strong communication skills.
* Has positive outlook always.
* Can multitask at a very high level and maintain multiple deadlines.
* Strong analytical skills including the ability to read and assess individual and company financial statements, cash flow, industry, and competitive analysis and projections.
* Proficiency with Excel and data interpretation are a must; familiarity with Adobe and CRM platforms would be a plus.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel required.

**Overnight Capital, LLC provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type with regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by the federal, state, or local laws.**

* Monday to Friday

title: Group Teacher in Infant Toddler Program
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a dedicated and nurturing Preschool Teacher to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience working with children of diverse abilities and backgrounds, and a passion for providing a safe and engaging learning environment. This role requires a strong understanding of childhood development, lesson planning, and the ability to adapt to the needs of our students.

Duties:

- Deliver ABA therapy  
- Provide individualized attention to students, addressing any special needs or requirements.  
- Develop and maintain a positive and inclusive classroom environment that promotes social and emotional growth.  
- Collaborate with colleagues to create a cohesive and comprehensive educational experience.  
- Utilize ABA methods to foster independence and self-directed learning.  
- Monitor and document student progress, identifying areas where additional support may be necessary.  
- Maintain a clean and organized classroom, adhering to health and safety regulations.  
- Engage with parents and guardians to provide regular updates on student progress and share suggestions for supporting their child's learning at home.

Qualifications:

Group teacher in an infant/toddler program.

A group teacher for an infant/toddler program shall be at least 21 years of age and have the following qualifications:

(1) Associate's (AA or AS) degree in early childhood education; or

(2) Child Development Associate (CDA) certification and a study plan leading to an associate's degree in early childhood education within seven years; or

(3) High school diploma or equivalent (GED); nine college credits in early childhood education or child development; two years’ experience caring for children, and a study plan leading to an associate's degree in early childhood education within seven years; or

(4) High school diploma or equivalent (GED) and five years of supervised experience in an infant/toddler classroom if currently employed in a permitted child care program; or

(5) High school diploma or equivalent (GED); and a study plan that is acceptable to the Department leading to nine credits in early childhood education or childhood development within two years; and a study plan leading to an associate's degree in early childhood education within seven years, if currently employed in a permitted child care program.

title: Branch Manager - 161st St.
description:
Bronx, New York  

East 161st St.  

Salary range: $105,000 - $165,000  

  

The Branch Manager oversees the day-to-day operations of the branch, ensuring quality customer service, while delivering results that align with Apple Bank’s business objectives. This position is responsible for the overall profitability of the branch by partnering with senior management (District Manager & Branch Network Managing Director) to implement strategies/activities to achieve the Bank’s overall goals for the assigned district. The incumbent drives new client acquisition primarily through deposit gathering (retaining & expanding existing banking relationships) and market share growth of the branch and implements sales, as well as business development initiatives that provide value to our customers, always ensuring that ethical sales practices are being adhered to. Additionally, the Branch Manager provides direction to staff regarding operational and regulatory controls, compliance matters, security protocols and how to protect the Bank against monetary loss and reputational harm. The Branch Manager must possess the ability to adapt accordingly to meet challenges in a dynamic industry.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities* Maintain a balance of sales, service, and operations objectives always.
* Oversee daily branch operations, provide comprehensive and prompt retail services; participate in daily operational and business development activities to achieve customer service and business growth objectives.
* Meet assigned sales goals by following our business development model and effectively utilizing the resources that have been provided.
* Manage account/deposit portfolios of the assigned branch; maintains strong relationships with top customers and seeks to grow and retain these relationships.
* Direct branch human capital activities, including but not limited to, staffing, training, delegation of work, performance appraisals, promotions, career development, and salary recommendations.
* Keep employees abreast of the latest internal policies and procedures and ensure employee compliance to them.
* Facilitate regular team meetings to discuss Bank and branch goals and objectives and establish priorities.
* Partner with the District Manager to develop and execute strategies for the branch that are aligned to business plans, to achieve desired revenue, expense, and service goals.
* Drive individual production goals with target clients and outbound sales activities, including the building of referral networks and relationships with internal partners and external contacts; implement new ideas and marketing strategies within branch market area to improve sales/deposit performance, marketing, and staff development.
* Ensure that audit controls are followed to protect the Bank from unnecessary risk and exposure by supporting compliance with regulatory guidelines including the Bank Secrecy Act, AML, Regulation CC and Regulation E.
* Keep abreast of customer banking needs by promoting new business and offering additional suitable products and services; addresses and resolves complex customer service issues, ensuring quick and proper responses to all reasonable customer requests.
* Review and reconcile various branch general ledger accounts; understand daily proof processes, ensuring adherence to operational requirements with the ability to investigate controllable losses.
* Develop new business relationships, representing Apple Bank in professional associations and community networking events to enhance its image and develop additional business/referral sources.
* Facilitate employee career growth through development planning, coaching, and training.


Additional Duties and Responsibilities* Promote a positive image of Apple Bank; develop and maintain effective business s relationships with customers and staff, serving as a liaison between branch and corporate departments.
* Staff the branch at an appropriate level; maintain schedules to always provided adequate coverage.
* Utilize prudent judgment when extending approvals for the processing of transactions (i.e., accepting checks, approving signatures, approving payments, and withdrawal transactions).
* Apply demonstrated knowledge of applicable banking laws and regulations; responds effectively and in a timely manner to organizational, business, and regulatory changes.
* Recommend systems and/or procedural changes to senior management.
* Participate in the periodic installation and testing of program updates (i.e., disaster recovery testing, ATM programs, scanning equipment programs, etc.).
* Notify appropriate personnel to ensure branch facilities and equipment are well maintained; ensure inventory and supplies are maintained.
* Delegate work to subordinates, including performing follow up and providing additional guidance when necessary.
* Analyze problems and develops sound strategies to provide optimum solutions for all aspects of branch management.
* Perform other duties as requested.


Skills, Education and Experience* High School diploma or GED required; Bachelor’s degree preferred.
* 7+ years of experience in banking and operations required, with at least 5 years of financial institution experience in a management function.
* Proven management record, preferably in banking or financial services.
* Excellent communication (verbal + written), problem solving, decision making and time management skills.
* Demonstrate effective leadership and interpersonal skills; motivate and achieve results through the effort of others.
* Must possess strong attention to detail with a high concern for accuracy.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite of products (Excel, Word & PowerPoint) and position specific software as required.
* Comprehensive knowledge regarding branch business operations and retail services.
* Demonstrated knowledge of e-Commerce, e-Banking and Branch Banking-related technology.
* Ability to manage multiple ad hoc assignments or situations and remains.
* Qualified to be licensed as a Notary Public for the State of New York.
* May be required to obtain insurance license for the sale of approved insurance/annuity products.


Visa sponsorship not available.*We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, military and/or veteran status, or any other Federal or State legally-protected classes.*

title: ESL Instructor; 2297-502-H
description:
For over 125 years, Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens has been providing quality social services to the neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens, and currently offers 160-plus programs and services for children, youth, adults, seniors, and those struggling with mental illness.
  
  

STATEMENT OF THE JOB
  
  

The E.S.L Instructor will be responsible to deliver the ESL classes and monitor and assure the progress of enrollees toward achieving the Program Performance targets and milestones.
  
  

* Provide Intake, Assessment and Orientation for each enrollee.
* Research and develop new resources and materials to enhance the teaching curricula.
* Provide class instruction in ESL.
* Administer BEST PLUS tests at intake and regularly thereafter to monitor and document enrollee progress.
* Maintain Milestone performance files for each enrollee.
* Maintain enrollee attendance. Follow-up with enrollees as needed to ensure their continued participation. Maintain office hours.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Bachelors Degree of Arts
* Two years’ experience teaching ESL to adults in a community based environment.
* Ability to work evenings and Saturdays as required.
* Ability to lift and carry supplies and equipment as needed between 5-10 pounds.
* Transportation time spent commuting between sites for meetings and trainings.
* Ability to travel to multiple locations as needed.


We offer competitive salary

title: Middle School Science Teacher
description:
Job Title: Science Teacher Job Summary: We are looking for a dedicated and enthusiastic Science Teacher to inspire and educate students in the field of science. The ideal candidate will create a dynamic learning environment, deliver engaging lessons, and promote a passion for scientific exploration among students. Duties: - Develop and implement comprehensive lesson plans that cater to the diverse learning needs of students - Foster a supportive and inclusive classroom atmosphere conducive to learning and experimentation - Utilize effective behavior management techniques to maintain a positive and focused learning environment - Assess student progress through various evaluation methods and adjust teaching strategies accordingly - Collaborate with fellow educators, parents, and administrators to enhance student learning outcomes - Integrate innovative teaching approaches to enhance student engagement and understanding of scientific concepts - Stay updated on current scientific research and trends to enrich classroom discussions Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in Education or relevant field (Master's degree preferred) - Experience working with students in a classroom setting - Proficiency in subjects such as Organic Chemistry, Genetics, Biochemistry, and Discrete Math - Familiarity with laboratory procedures and equipment - Strong background in scientific research methodologies - Knowledge of library services for sourcing educational materials is advantageous Benefits: - Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications - Professional development opportunities to enhance teaching skills - Comprehensive health benefits package - Supportive work environment that values creativity and innovation If you are a passionate educator with a love for science and a desire to inspire the next generation of scientists, we invite you to apply for the Science Teacher position. Join our team and help shape young minds through the wonders of science!
