title: Manager Program Implementation
description:
**Requisition**: 79035


**PSEG Company:** Public Service Electric & Gas Co.

**Salary Range**: $ 114,500 - $ 188,100

**Incentive**: PIP 15%

**Work Location Category**: Hybrid

  

PSEG operates under a Flexible Work Model where flexible work is offered when job requirements allow. In support of this model, roles have been categorized into one of four work location categories: onsite roles, hybrid roles that are a blend of onsite and remote work, remote local roles that are primarily home-based but require some level of purpose-driven in-person interaction and living within a commutable distance, and remote non-local roles that can be effectively performed remotely with the ability to work in approved states.


We want you to be healthy, balanced, and feel secure. That’s why you’ll enjoy a comprehensive range of benefits, with a focus on supporting your whole health. Starting on day one of your employment, you’ll be offered several health-related benefits including medical, vision, dental, and well-being and behavioral health programs. We also offer a retirement program, 401(k) with company match, company paid life insurance, tuition reimbursement and a minimum of 18 days of paid time off per year.


PSEG offers a unique experience to our more than 12,000 employees – we provide the resources and opportunities for career development that come with being a Fortune 500 company, as well as the attention, camaraderie and care for one another you might typically associate with a small business. Our focus on combatting climate change through clean energy technology, our new net zero climate vision for 2030 and enhanced commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion; and supporting the communities we serve make this a particularly exciting time to join PSEG.


**Job Summary**
---------------


Provides leadership, operations strategy, resources and activities for program implementation for demand-side management to achieve Residential/C&I energy efficiency program goals and deliverables, including scorecard results and P&L responsiblity. Leads the launch of new products, programs and service through cross-functional teams including operations, legal, regulatory and procurement.

**Job Responsibilities**
------------------------

* Develop and lead the processes and activities for the implementation and delivery of demand-side management and other energy efficiency products/services for PSEG's energy efficiency programs through cross-functional teams.
* Manage internal associate and external vendors to ensure program deliverables are met while ensuring high level of safety, compliance and customer satisfaction across all programs.
* Provide leadership and guidance to internal constituents for improving current processes, policies and procedures; provide expert consultation towards the assessment and development of new products, programs and services.
* Develop partnerships and manage vendor and trade ally realtionships to assist in delivering current energy efficiency programs and to build support for future programs; represent the company on enternal committees, including BPU-sponsored working groups.
* Manage the developments, maintenance and enhancement of IT systems to manage programs and report results.
* Develop and monitor program budgets and support regulatory filings.
* Provide and foster a robust culture of integrity, diversity, teamwork, comfort in speaking up, safety and wellness.
**Job Specific Qualifications**
-------------------------------

**Required:**

* Bachelors Degree in Engineering or Business.
* 6+ years related external or internal experience.
* Demonstrated knowledge of demand response programs
* Working knowledge of utility regulation and accounting principles.

**Desired:**

* Demonstrated knowledge of PJM capacity markets.
* Demonstrated knowledge of the utility industry.
**Minimum Years of Experience**
-------------------------------


6 years of experience**Disclaimer**
--------------

title: Sanitation Supervisor
description:
**Sanitation Manager || Clifton OR Newark, NJ**

**Job Description**

The Sanitation manager will lead the effort to ensure that the plant is clean and sanitary as per the SQF & FDA guidelines. This person will set up and manage a comprehensive Sanitation, Pest Control, and Waste Management program and will be responsible for scheduling a sanitation crew on days with no production. Daily sanitation provides a crew of 12 during the day, and 2 at night; Additional personnel up to 13 employees will be provided on those days when detailed cleaning is possible. Leadership will be hands-on, thus training his or her entire crew in how to be efficient (and cost-effective) in cleaning and sanitizing machines (including frames and other covers), plant fixtures, and their flooring. The Sanitation manager will also train Line Operators how to maintain their area compliant to Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP). Weekly reports (used in monitoring) are provided to the Plant Manager and Quality Assurance. The Quality Assurance Department will provide daily feedback to the Sanitation manager, who will report directly to the Director of Quality.

· A minimum of three years’ experience in the food manufacturing industry.

· Must possess knowledge of SQF, GMP, HACCP, Allergen Programs, Waste Management and Product Storage.

· Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, planning, and conflict resolution skills.

· Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with strong analytical and critical thinking skills.

· Ability to prioritize tasks and delegate them when appropriate.

· Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.

· Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) and able to communicate with all levels of the business.

· High tolerance for stress and ability to demonstrate sound judgment and decision- making under pressure.

**Responsibilities**

· Requisition of Cleaning Materials and Company-Approved Chemicals, and Maintenance of Cleaning Equipment

· Pest Control and Waste Management Program.

· Adhering to the SQF Requirements.

· Scheduling of Sanitation Crew

· Training of Production Personnel

· Recommendation / Revision of Sanitation Standards

· The Sanitation Manager will oversee adherence to proper allergen control.

Details of cleanup are to be reported to Quality Assurance Department.

· During Production-Twice a day (one in the morning and one in the afternoon), a walk-through will be conducted by the Sanitation Supervisor and Quality Assurance and note down areas that need additional sanitation detailing. There should be a completion of at least 80%.

· During Designated Sanitation Days - d there should be at least 95% completion of the sanitation list and those required by the Master Sanitation Schedule. Quality Assurance will provide the weekly rating to the Plant Manager.

· Performs other duties as assigned.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $65,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday
* Night shift

Application Question(s):

* Nice to have Food industry Experience.

Work Location: On the road

title: Installation Manager
description:
**Efficient Air Service** is currently hiring for a **full-time Installation Manager** to coordinate our activities and serve as a link between the office and the field in the **Riverdale, NJ** area. This HVAC office position earns a **competitive salary** of **$70,000 - $90,000/year**, depending on experience.


In addition to **competitive pay** and our **supportive culture**, we offer our HVAC accounting team the following benefits:

* Health
* Vision
* 401(k) with match
* Paid time off (PTO)
* Incentives
* Bonuses
* Year-round work
* Uniforms
* A company vehicle **if applicable**


So, now that you've learned the who, what, where, and why, you may be wondering HOW? It's easy! Just fill out our initial **mobile-friendly online application**. We hope to meet you soon!

 **DAY-TO-DAY**


As an Installation Manager, you are the grease that keeps the wheels of our company turning. As the link between our office and the technicians in the field, you make sure that we are organized, quality-oriented, and productive. Calling upon your general knowledge of job costing, you ensure that we stick to our budget and maintain profitability. With efficiency, you develop plans for installs and ensure that our technicians have the materials they need to fulfill our contractual obligations. You also see to it that our technicians are well trained and that every installation is done according to established policies and procedures. With you in the office coordinating the work, we meet our company goals, and our employees progress in their careers. Under your watchful eye, our business thrives, and you take great satisfaction in seeing our success!

 **THE HISTORY AND CORE VALUES THAT GUIDE EFFICIENT AIR SERVICE**


Efficient Air Service is a family-owned business founded in 2005 by Albert M. Balonze, Jr. Since then, we have strived to take pride in our work, be honest, and have the integrity it takes to gain repeat customers. Our continuously trained technicians are confident in their abilities to provide 100 percent satisfaction on any and every job, each time.


In the field and in the office, our employees support one another in this fast-paced environment. We are a dedicated team of friendly attitudes with a strong work ethic. Our team is the backbone of our company which is why **we celebrate their individual successes and growth,** as well as the **overall achievements of the company.** As the company grows, we continuously work to preserve our core small business values by treating our employees with **respect and integrity.**

 **OUR IDEAL INSTALLATION MANAGER**

* Organized - able to prioritize multiple tasks and manage their time
* A leader - able to inspire and help their team succeed
* Attentive - pay close attention to detail
* A team player - able to communicate and work effectively as a team


If this sounds like you, keep reading!

 **REQUIREMENTS FOR AN INSTALLATION MANAGER**

* 2+ years of management experience
* General understanding of the HVAC, Sheetmetal, & Plumbing industry
* Understanding of accounting as it relates to the industry
* HVAC service and install experience
* Basic computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite
* Valid Driver's License
* Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Knowledge of local code requirements
* Attended vocational school


If you meet the above requirements, we need you. Apply today to join our HVAC accounting team as an Installation Manager!


Location: 07457
company_description: Since 2005, Efficient Air has strived to be the top trusted residential HVAC service company in Northern New Jersey. Come join the best of the best!

title: Field RN Manhattan, NY
description:
**$5,000 Sign-on Bonus for External Candidates**



Optum Home & Community Care, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, is creating something new in health care. We are uniting industry-leading solutions to build an integrated care model that holistically addresses an individual’s physical, mental and social needs – helping patients access and navigate care anytime and anywhere.

  



As a team member of our Senior Community Care (SCC) product, we work with a team to provide care to patients at home in a nursing home, assisted living for senior housing. This life-changing work adds a layer of support to improve access to care.

  

We’re connecting care to create a seamless health journey for patients across care settings. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Ensure accurate and complete documentation
* Communicate and collaborate with the interdisciplinary care team
* Assist the provider / team with various care coordination activities
* Assist the provider / team with benefit determination associated with Medicare part A, part B, and part D benefits
* Collaborating with the primary advanced practice clinician, (APC) and facility to identify and respond to patient change in condition
* Assist the provider / team with therapy coordination
* Participate in facility-based meetings
* Schedule and participate in family conferences, team meetings, and team case presentations
* Coordination of training, tracking, and compliance with quality measures
* Assist in creating and conduct in-services for selected audiences
* Assist Providers in assuring complete and accurate documentation and coding, medication reconciliation, nursing rounds, assessment, and patient documentation
* May write verbal orders from Provider in the chart in compliance with the state RN practice laws, and in compliance with individual nursing facility practices
* Assist in managing members through an acute medical situation or an exacerbation of a chronic condition, including testing, diagnostics, interventions
* Assist in managing members during a short term sub-acute rehabilitation episode


You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* Associate degree or higher in Nursing (RN)
* Active and unrestricted license in the state which you reside, or ability to obtain by start date
* Certified in Basic Life Support
* 3+ years of clinical experience in practice
* Proven ability to complete physical requirements, including lifting a 30-pound bag and ability to perform physical assessment
* Access to reliable transportation


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Experience in meeting the medical needs of patients with complex behavioral, social and/or functional needs
* Understanding of geriatrics and chronic illness
* Proficient computer skills including the ability to document medical information with written and electronic medical records
* Proven ability to work with diverse care teams in a variety of settings
* Proven effective communication skills and time management

  

  

**New York Residents Only:** The salary range for this role is $58,300 to $114,300 annually. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.



*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*

  


*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: Optumc is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

  

*UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*
company_description: Optum is a health services and innovation company on a mission to help people live healthier lives and to help make the health system work better for everyone.

title: Delivery Driver
description:
Company seeks an experienced and responsible 26 ft box truck driver for consistent work 6 days a week Monday-Saturday.

License must be SQUEAKY clean and driver must have a medical card.

The deliveries are local to the Stamford, CT area. Driver is home every night. Shift starts at 2:00pm and ends around 8:30pm.

Pay is $145 per day.

Driver will need clean Motor Vehicle Record and updated medical card.

Responsibilities:  
- Safely and efficiently operate a box truck to transport goods to customers  
- Follow assigned routes and schedules to ensure timely deliveries  
- Load and unload cargo using lift gate/sometimes dock  
- Verify the ACCURACY of delivery orders and obtain necessary signatures or proof of delivery  
- Provide exceptional customer service by addressing customer inquiries and concerns in a professional manner  
- Maintain cleanliness and organization of the delivery vehicle

Qualifications  
- Valid driver's license with a clean driving record  
- Experience driving commercial vehicles, such as vans or box trucks, preferred  
- Strong knowledge of local traffic laws and regulations  
- Excellent time management skills to ensure on-time deliveries  
- Ability to lift heavy objects and perform physical tasks associated with loading and unloading cargo  
- Good communication skills to interact with customers and team members effectively

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $145.00 per day

Expected hours: No more than 42 per week

Benefits:

* Company truck
* Paid training

Shift:

* Day shift

Work Days:

* Weekends as needed

Work Location: On the road

title: Restaurant Customer Service / Cashier
description:
unior's Restaurant, located at 386 Flatbush Ave. Ext (DeKalb) in Brooklyn,is now hiring full-time and part-time cashier's for our iconic New York City restaurant

We serve a full menu of classic NYC comfort food at Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and Late Night Dining. Our restaurants are some of the busiest independant restaruants in the United States. They feature a full bar, outdoor dining, large indoor dining rooms, and retail Bakery & Take Out departments.

Both AM and PM Shifts are available. Full Time preferred, but Part Time schedules will be considered. We work on weekends and holidays, which are some of our busiest times. Anyone applying should plan to work during those times. Successful applicants will be able to demonstrate a history of responsibility & reliability in previous employment, project an outgoing and positive image, have a helpful "anything that is needed," attitude with a strong work ethic. Must be able to work in a fast-paced restaurant environment, with a large and diverse staff. If you don't play well with others of different races, ethnicities, nationalities, religions or sexual orientations, this is likely not the enviornment for you.

**Responsibilities:**

* Serve food and beverages to guests
* Explain and advise guests in menu items
* Take accurate orders and enter accurately into the POS
* Maintain, stock, and clean service areas
* Greet and make all guests feel welcome at the restaurant with superior hospitality
* Respond to guest inquiries and requests with urgency
* Perform any other restaurant duties to make our restaurant better. This is a team based establishment.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience serving in a similar high-volume restaurant environment
* Ability to build rapport with guests and co-workers from all walks of life
* Ability to work primarily on your feet for 8-10 hours
* Ability to lift a minimum of 20 lbs above your head
* Ability to multi-task, stay organized, and thrive in a fast-paced environment
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Project a professional, polished image

* Flexible schedule
